name: Mama Shelter

reviews.text: Hotel: it's a modern building. Very unusual and very nicely done bar and restaurant.
reviews.title: Loved it. For the money; amazing

reviews.text: Room: I had a luxe double. It was a decent size and very very comfortable and nicely done. The bed was amazing. Very nice walk in overhead shower. Great TV with TV, free films, including "romantic" ones! Large window one can open. I loved the room. For the price the room exceeded my expectations considerably.
reviews.title: Mama Marseille

reviews.text: Staff: friendly and helpful. And attractive! Perfect.
reviews.title: A nice oasis in Marseille

reviews.text: Location: the hotel is in a quiet residential area a 10-15 minute walk from the port / centre. For me it was perfect as its a 3 minute walk from Le cour Julien with all it's small streets full of restaurants and a short walk to the terminus of the buses going to the beaches. There is a small triangle outside the hotel with a shop selling pastries etc, a small restaurant where one can get coffee and cigarettes and a take away pizzeria, but one can eat it on the terrace.
reviews.title: Great design in a very friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after a short visit in 2012. Its a great hotel even for a family although we're not the target group. The rooms are modern, functional and comfortable. The real strengths of this place are the staff who are fabulous and the location which is close to the touristy areas but far enough away to allow for a small window on an interesting part of real Marseille. Always enjoy the breakfast and this time had an lovely evening meal on the terrace while the children played chess in the "wading pool". Book ahead for a good room price.
reviews.title: Good choice to stay in Marseille

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for one night as we were on a roadtrip. We were asked to pay 169€ for a medium size room where parking and breakfast were not included in the price!! (parking is an extra 17 euros/day and breakfast and extra 15 euros/person)
reviews.title: No reason to stay unless pretentious-hipster-hostel is your style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The bathroom was very small and so badly designed that after a quick shower the floor was flooded! Moreover we were offered only one (bad) product that was supposed to be for the hair, face and body... oh, and towels. But that's it! They offer nothing more. Not even hand soap!
reviews.title: Good hotel with great staff

reviews.text: -There was no closet but only two small rails with 4-5 hangers and a shelf instead.
reviews.title: Unique and trendy in Marseille

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -There was a kettle, a microwave and a sink only to make a reference to the hostel it is.
reviews.title: Sexy hotel about 20 min walk from vieux port

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The bed was good. (but it should be kind of a given in a hotel. Especially what it's SO expensive!)
reviews.title: Funky new hotel that even suits older

reviews.text: Well I'm going to kind of buck the trend of the glowing reviews about Mama Shelter. It was OK... nothing more than that and a few points that need to be looked at.
reviews.title: Trying to be too many things and completely in wrong area

reviews.text: I got a really good rate for this hotel with the new year offer on the Mama website of a certain amount of rooms at only €49 - so a two night stay for less than €100 was a good deal, so I can't complain about that. Breakfast is an additional €15 a night. Better still I even got a better class of room than I had booked.
reviews.title: I would stay there again

reviews.text: Now the good and the bad ....
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The room decor is 'minimal' bare concrete passing as trendy, with the odd wall painted in pink emulsion. But nothing too offensive. Furniture sparse but enough for a short stay. Bed was two singles pushed together which was fine other than that pushing the two head boards (which also double as lights) meant you couldn't turn one on as the switch was sqaushed between the two.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TV (imac) is fine - great selection of on demand films. Usual lack of English language channels though. Wifi in room is great and works well. Oddly 'internet' available on the imac but no keyboard provided to actually use it ...
reviews.title: Wonderful unique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute we stepped inside this hotel, we could tell that it was very different to most other hotels. The lobby is small but full of interesting furniture and things to look at. The staff on reception were very helpful and welcoming. The bedroom is very different to any other hotel room I have ever seen! The walls are bare concrete and the floor covering is lino. The only furniture in the room is the bed in the middle with an integral desk behind the bedhead, and two small bedside tables that pull out from under the bed. The only things on the wall were three masks and two very large mirrors propped at the side of the bed. So it's not Louis XV in style, but it is stylish...and incredibly comfortable and spotlessly clean! I loved it because it is so different and an absolute bargain for a city-centre boutique hotel.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel....

reviews.text: We stayed on a busy Saturday night, so the restaurant was very busy the next morning for breakfast. I was disappointed to see that very few tables were being cleared away, and we had to do this ourselves....and we were not the only ones. However the day after our stay, I received a survey by email and I fed this back, and was very pleasantly surprised to received a reply from the manager apologising for this and ensuring it would be fed back. I definitely got the impression they are serious about customer service.
reviews.title: Bounjour Design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located about 15 minutes walk from the old port and you will have to make up your own mind about this. Marseille is definitely an edgy city and some guests may feel more comfortable with this than others. We are well travelled and not really phased by much and we were happy to walk during the day, but preferred to take the metro in the evening and there are two stations very close by.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel experience
Great hotel!
reviews.text: All in all, I loved my stay at Mama Shelter and hope to return, as well as try the other hotels they have elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what a lovely hotel in the best place of Europeans culture capital of 2013. You can have a drink at the bar with overhead live belts , you can sit at the Mac and check your mails like in an Arabian Souk . When you wake up tell the hotel staff "Mama please clean my room"
reviews.title: Good value for money and friendly staff

description: So much more than a place to sleep, Mama Shelter is an urban kibbutz, where people gather around a shared meal, a live band, unpredictable encounters.127 rooms of between 15 and 45 m2 spread over six floors with the option of five categories. It features a simple cuisine created by Alain Senderens who celebrates Mediterranean cooking in the city without resorting to the cliché of traditional Marseille dishes.
